update.description:
There are a couple of important points here, which probably deserve to look at separate commits:

 * [Rethink and change](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/e9352f0a2330ee0680b2e2f99eb764f1c40c8972) previous definition of gz_build_ DISPLAY, DRI and Qt. New approach is: DRI and DISPLAY do not go for linking to Qt. Qt is a separate macro which depends on VALID_DRI. Seems to work fine for current test suite.
 * Regression tests needed to link against extra sources (server.cc, master.cc, ...) due to use of TextFixture file. To avoid code duplication, [a hack was done](#!/osrf/gazebo/commits/2c2e2318c0bad1231edbb5766ab192c5464d181b) to provide extra sources in a variable, since all arguments passed to the macro are consider test source files.

Further work is needed to move some tests from regression to proper unit test places but this out of the scope of this pull request.
update.title: Move regression tests to use proper gz build functions

content.raw: I had some comments below about the physics test and some others that are listed as needing a DISPLAY, when they don't actually need one. They complain if they don't have one, but still function. My concern is we won't be running as many tests in some of the Jenkins slaves as we could.
content.html: I had some comments below about the physics test and some others that are listed as needing a DISPLAY, when they don't actually need one. They complain if they don't have one, but still function. My concern is we won't be running as many tests in some of the Jenkins slaves as we could.

content.html: Update this pull request to also fix the data logger test and heightmap test. All tests should pass now.

pullrequest.title: Move regression tests to use proper gz build functions

content.raw: I don't think these tests actually need a DISPLAY (except the bandwidth test which needs a camera sensor). They complain when run without a display because Server::Load calls `sensors::load();` which calls `gazebo::rendering::load();`. Without a display, these generate complaints at the console, but the test can still proceed properly.
content.html: I don't think these tests actually need a DISPLAY (except the bandwidth test which needs a camera sensor). They complain when run without a display because Server::Load calls sensors::load(); which calls gazebo::rendering::load();. Without a display, these generate complaints at the console, but the test can still proceed properly.
